hackathon-judges.judge-role: Senior Technology Evangelist / Amazon Web Services

hackathon-rules:
1)  It is required that your team register (click on "Enter an Application") on ChallengePost (
) by Sunday, Sept. 29, at 3:00 PM, so that we can circulate our itinerary of team pitches.   
2)  Teams are strictly limited to five (5) members, but can have as few as one (1) member.   
3) So that team membership is limited to members who actually contribute, team members can, by a 2/3 majority vote, elect to remove a non-participating team member from their team by Sunday, Sept. 29, at 3:00 PM by contacting Brandon on the DataWeek team (
).   
 4)  It is not required that you utilize a sponsor's technology, however there are several sponsor prizes that are only available to teams building on their technology!  (Details will be release at the hackathon.)     
   
1)  Every team will receive two (2) minutes to present their projects, followed by 30 seconds or 1 minute of judges' Q&A (Q&A time will be decided by Sunday, Sept. 29, at 3:30 PM, based on the number of eligible teams, so all judging is completed within two (2) hours.)   
2)  Teams will share their presentation media (PowerPoint, Keynote, executable files, video, etc.) via Dropbox per instructions sent out to all teams by Saturday, Sept. 28, at 10:00 PM. You may also load your web app on our presentation laptop by Sunday, Sept. 29, at 3:45 PM.   
3) ALL PRESENTATIONS MUST BE SENT TO US BY SUNDAY, SEPT. 29, at 3:45 PM, TO QUALIFY TO BE JUDGED!!!!     
4) Judges will review projects based on three (3) criteria: (1) Quality of presentation and communication; (2) Progress of the app, especially as it relates to using data/APIs in interesting/unique ways; and (3) Feasibility as a startup company -- with a clear customer and a clear business model.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: 1) GreenQloud credit of $2,000.00 towards GreenQloud services (ComputeQloud, StorageQloud / QloudSync). Not exchangeable for cash. Non-transferrable.

A team trip to Iceland (up to 2 people which would include round trip economy flight from Continental Europe, Canada, Continental US or the Nordics. Plus 3 nights hotel. Travel to be booked and completed for dates between January 2014- June 2014.

AccoutingSuite API is all about creating a connection between a user and the various avenues in which their business is done. What we’d like to see is a functional and effective integration which might benefit the average AccountingSuite user. For example,  our API is commonly used for reporting, BI, and E-commerce; however, extra points will be considered for the more creative endeavors.
Chartio free account for six months + A special Nerf surprise!

Pearson is offering (2) $500 scholarships to teams that are looking to build innovative applications using Pearson APIs. We are looking for teams that have a big vision but can also execute on their application during the short hackathon.
AT&T Developer Program gives you access to the tools you need to build, test, onboard and certify applications across a range of devices, OS’s and platforms.

D&B will award $500 to (2) developer teams that propose the best application of the D&B API in the sales, marketing, web, mobile, or supply chain use cases. Possible ideas could be data mashups with stock prices, trending news, or business reviews. D&B Direct is an API web services platform which enables easy integration of D&B’s world-leading database of over 210M companies, 100M contacts, financial information, company profiles, Hoover’s industry research and more, and combines it with external data like social media and news, to deliver real-time intelligence into any application, such as CRM systems, corporate intranets and webforms, and supply chain management systems. D&B Direct API Examples of use cases built with the D&B Direct API can be found at:

The Disqus API is a huge, valuable resource that has been largely untapped - until now. With over 1 million comments posted daily across thousands of active communities, you're bound to find something interesting. The average Disqus user is commenting about their passions spanning multiple sites. Use this data to build interesting projects that go beyond superficial social data. You'll learn about how the discussion data is bucketed and connected between communities, discussions and users, and how to navigate this network via the public API. Take advantage of contextual conversations to build smarter applications faster.

hackathon-description-header: Come Hack at the San Francisco's Largest Data & API Conference
